answers.answer: Im the same way you are. I cant even have fathom the thought of having a male doctor looking at my private parts

I always felt more awkward with my male doctor, even discussing my period and things. Don't get me wrong, he was a wonderful doctor, but i just feel much more comfortable explaining my female problems and concerns to a female doctor. And definitely getting pap smears by a female. Either way it's awkward lol
I pretty much refuse to have a male doctor. I want to be comfortable. The only male I want in the room is my husband. :)
It doesn't matter to me. They're all preffesional. And I'm sure they've seen worse lol. I had a male doctor check me and break my water while I was in labor.

Male doctors are very compassionate because they don't understand the actual physical pain we go through. Women are nice but I like either one. I have had a male gyn before so men Ob doctors don't bother me.
I actually prefer male doctors because the female doctors have had were more rough and harsh and then male doctors have been more gentle down there.

i wanted a female doctor but, winded up getting stuck with a male. it was uncomfortable at first, then i found out he saved my baby nephew when he was born because his mom had developed real bad preeclampsia. now im so grateful to have the same doc, cause if something goes wrong i know he'll make the right call.

My family practitioner from age 7-24 was an absolutely awesome professional smart caring man. He did my first pap smear, my first annual gynecological exams, my first breast exams. He was an amazing doctor and I trusted him wholeheartedly. He no longer practices in my area and I'm really bummed about that. Haven't found a GP I like half as much.I have not received prenatal care from any men, however - I've never met a male midwife - though if there was a man in practice with my chosen team of midwives I would certainly welcome care from anyone as well trained and well informed and caring and courteous as the women I receive care from now. What genitals my caregiver has doesnt affect me - how they treat me does.
The male obgyn that deliveried my son was amazing and the only problem I had with him was huge fingers he was gentle but had pork fingers lol

Don't get me wrong my pediatrician is a male. He was my pediatrician when I was a kid, is my sons, and will be my next childs. I feel an ob is different. I actually won't go ti an ob. Went at first with my son and hated it so I found my midwife at 3 months and loved her with my son. Also actually going to her now.

Ive never had a male Dr or ever wanted one till this pregnancy. I have always preferred a female. But a couple years ago I had a miscarriage and this Dr helped me out while I was in the ER and seen me for follow ups afterwards, so I thought I would use him during this pregnancy seeming how the hospital is so close to our house and he was aware of my past experience. I was nervous and uncomfortable at first but he has been very gentle and compassionate about everything.
I had to get a pap test done from a male doctor one and I was very uncomfortable and then after he asked me for my number!  How awkward!  So yeah Just female doctors for me! :)

I have a male ob. He is a father of four, is regularly on the news reporting on current research, and is the head of the Australian Medical Association. His qualifications and experience mattered more to me then his gender. I just wanted the best because of my health and I think he's amazing. We're now having baby #2 after thinking I wouldn't survive one.

question: I like a woman doctor better I had some male doctor who look at my private area and I felt uncomfortable but I love my doctor she so caring and supportive to me and when she checks me she not ruff like most guy doctors any woman disagree with my opinion or had male doctors who were great
title: Any ladies feel comfortable with a woman doctor than a male doctor l
